Russia's intrusion into Polish airspace exposes NATO's vulnerabilities against drones
subhead: While Russia denied that the incident was intentional, experts believe the unarmed drones were likely meant to test NATO's response capabilities, which proved inadequate. President Emmanuel Macron announced France would send three Rafale fighter jets to Poland.
byline: By Chloé Hoorman and Elise Vincent

title: Charlie Kirk shooting: A suspect, a man named Tyler Robinson, has been arrested
UN General Assembly votes for Hamas-free two-state solution
France's new PM Lecornu faces immediate wall of mistrust
subhead: The prime minister has started consultations with political parties and labor unions. While an agreement between the centrist bloc and the right is possible, the Socialists are still hesitant to compromise.
byline: By Sandrine Cassini, Mariama Darame and Marie Pouzadoux

title: Qatar's foreign ministry decries Israeli strike as 'nothing less than state terrorism'
subhead: The spokesperson for Qatar's foreign ministry told Le Monde that the Gulf emirate is considering legal action against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, whom he describes as a 'thug' and 'unhinged.'

title: French Constitutional Council upholds GAFA tax
subhead: In a decision issued on Friday, September 12, at the request of German media group Axel Springer, France's Constitutional Council confirmed the constitutionality of the digital services tax introduced in 2019.
byline: By Denis Cosnard and Alexandre Piquard

title: Takeaways from France's 'Block Everything' protests: 'A lot of anger is building up around issues of social injustice'

title: From a Thai holiday to a Turkish prison: How two women were trapped by drug traffickers
subhead: The two 20-year-old women from the Paris region enjoyed an all-expenses-paid holiday in Thailand, then given suitcases packed with cannabis before their flight home. Their lawyers argued it was a case of 'great naivety.'

title: Hyundai and LG's giant US plant in shock after massive immigration raid
subhead: The South Korean companies' metaplant in Georgia was the target of a vast federal immigration raid on September 4, during which 475 people were detained.

title: France's 'Block Everything' protests converge around ousting Macron
subhead: Although France did not come to a standstill or grind to a halt on Wednesday, numerous protests took place throughout the day across the country with large gatherings in certain cities – with headcounts between 197,000 and 250,000 people – amid the firm presence of law enforcement.
byline: By Thibaud Métais (with Le Monde's correspondents and reporters)
